725524f-b.text:
62nd Drive (right telegraph poles thereon; viewing northwest) south side, between 108th Street (background) and 11Oth Street (foreground to be constructed, just east of the barns) showing in three views the Lott farmhouse. Johannes S. Lott, a farmer, lived near Woodhaven. His son Stephen II. Lott was born their in 1799. He married Cornelia Rapelje and sold his property in the town of Jamaica in 1834 and removed to the first mentioned location. 8e died in Jamaica South, in 1871. His son Abraham Van Siclen LLott was born at Woodhaven in 1829 and married Cornelia De Bevoise of Dutch Kills in 1864. About 1869, he and his brother John Henry rented this homestead; his father removing to Jamaica South. When the estate was settled, this property, now called Viamede, c ame
N  into the possession of Abraham V.S. Lott.
April 1923.
Views 1,2 and 3
Eugene L. Anmbruster Collection

725520f-c.text:
62nd Drive south side, between 108th and 110th Streets (formerly Colonial Avenue), showing in three views the Stephen I. Lott farmhouse; also known as the A.V.II. Lott house. The first named Lott lived here from 1852 to 1860; the second from 1873 to 1896. The house
was still the Lott property in 1926.
1922
View 2: March 1925
View 3: May 1926.
Eugene L. ArMbruster Collection

725522f-a.text:
62nd Drive (along line of fence in center of view) sorth side, between 108th and 110th Streets. In the foreground is Colonial Avenue (formerly Mill Road, a nd later North Hempstead Plank Road. The house seen in this view is known as the Stephen I 1ott farmhouse, and it was erected on the site of an older house in 1843.
April 1923
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

725523f-c.text:
62nd Drive, (in front of house in background) south side, between 108th Street,right,and 11Oth Street (left). The telegraph poles at the left are on Colonial Avenue which terminates at the bend in the background where 110th Street continues south. This is a set of three views, No. 1 of which is viewed southward across Nill Creek from the Coe farmhouse located at Colonial Avenue and Nassau Boulevard. Views Nos. 2 and 3 are looking south from Northern Boulevard, showing the Lott house (white) in center of
view.
May 1928
Views 1 and 2
Views 3&41Oct. 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
